Haddington can now boast of no great manufacturing industry

column162: and though a vast amount of agricultural produce changes hands at its weekly markets. A woollen manufacture on an extensive scale was begun in 1681 in the suburb of Nungate by a company employing English workmen. It purchased some of the lands that had formerly belonged to the monastery

Haddington is a royal burgh of very ancient standing

At one time Haddington was the seat of a circuit justiciary court; but it now sends all its justiciary business to Edinburgh. The parish of Haddington occupies the centre of Haddingtonshire
